programme.title: Tea with the Dames
programme.desc: Four old friends will reflect on their lives and careers, as they spend a weekend together at the retreat once shared by Joan Plowright and Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Mary Shelley
programme.desc: The love affair between poet Percy Shelley and 18-year-old Mary Wollstonecraft Godwin, which resulted in Mary Shelley writing Frankenstein.

programme.title: Creation
programme.desc: Charles Darwin struggles to find a balance between his ideas of evolution and his relationship with his devout wife.

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In early 20th-century Britain, a young working mother joins a diverse group of women who fight for equality and the right to vote.

programme.title: Dom Hemingway
programme.desc: Dom Hemingway is a larger-than-life safecracker with a loose fuse. Back on the streets of London after twelve years in prison, it's time to collect what he's owed for keeping his mouth shut.

programme.title: I, Daniel Blake
programme.desc: When a middle-aged carpenter suffers a heart attack, he struggles as he must work his way through the bureaucratic world of welfare.

programme.title: A United Kingdom
programme.desc: The true story of the King of Bechuanaland, and the London office worker he married despite fierce opposition from the British and South African governments.

programme.title: Route Irish
programme.desc: A security contractor in Iraq rejects the official explanation of his friend's death and decides to investigate.

programme.title: Age of Heroes
programme.desc: This action adventure documents the true story of the elite 30 Commando unit, formed during World War II by the man who would later become novelist Ian Fleming, and their risky mission in Norway.

programme.title: Six Minutes to Midnight
programme.desc: Seventeen days before WWII, a teacher must try to exonerate himself in time to save the hearts and minds of his students from the grip of Hitler.

programme.title: Death at a Funeral
programme.desc: A dignified send-off for a loved one erupts into uproarious chaos when a myriad of outrageous calamities befall the eccentric grief stricken mourners.

programme.title: 6 Days
programme.desc: The incredible true story of six days of terror, after six heavily-armed gunmen invade the Iranian Embassy in London in 1980 and take 26 people hostage.

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: The captivating, true story of a man who discovers the Japanese officer who tortured him during the war is still alive, and sets out to confront him.

programme.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
programme.desc: An alien touring the galaxy breaks away from her group and meets two young inhabitants of the most dangerous place in the universe: the London suburb of Croydon.

programme.title: Red Joan
programme.desc: Inspired by the true story of English-born Joan Stanley, who was recruited by the KGB in the mid 1930s and went undetected as a British spy for over a half a century.

programme.title: The Bookshop
programme.desc: Set in a small town in 1959 England, a woman decides, against polite but ruthless local opposition, to open a bookshop, a decision which becomes a political minefield.

programme.desc: This action adventure documents the true story of the elite 30 Commando unit, formed during World War II by the man who would later become novelist Ian Fleming, and their risky mission in Norway.

programme.title: Comes a Bright Day
programme.desc: Love blooms in the most unusual circumstances when a bellboy and a beautiful shopgirl are taken hostage in a jewel store heist.

programme.title: Hyde Park on Hudson
programme.desc: Global affairs are juggled with the all-too-human side of one of history's iconic leaders Franklin D. Roosevelt as he hosts the English royals for an unforgettable weekend in upstate NY.

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham
programme.desc: An Indian girl born in England disobeys her strict family in search of a dream: becoming a soccer star like her idol, David Beckham.

programme.title: A Bump Along The Way
programme.desc: Forty-four-year-old single mother, Pamela, finds herself pregnant after a drunken one-night-stand, leaving her tightly-wound teen daughter, Allegra, ashamed of her deadbeat mum.

programme.title: Coriolanus
programme.desc: After being banished from Rome, a revered and feared Roman General allies himself with his sworn enemy to take his revenge on the city.

programme.title: Ali & Ava
programme.desc: Ali and Ava, both lonely for different reasons, meet and sparks fly. A connection grows, despite the legacy of Ava's past relationship, and Ali's turmoil at the breakdown of his marriage.

programme.title: Freight
programme.desc: A Russian gang in the UK traffic eastern European people and then enslave them, the women to sex, the men to illegal fights. They cross a local businessman, and a war escalates.

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant lands in 1950s Brooklyn, where she falls in love with a local. But when her past catches up with her, she must choose between two countries.

programme.title: Neds
programme.desc: Encompassed by violent street gangs, neglectful parents, bullying teachers and a lack of positive role models, a studious, but emotionally abandoned kid turns thug.

programme.title: Ammonite
programme.desc: In 1840s England, acclaimed but overlooked fossil hunter Mary Anning and a young woman sent to convalesce by the sea develop an intense relationship, altering both of their lives forever.

programme.title: Swimming with Men
programme.desc: Eric joins an all-male group of synchronised swimmers, discovering that making patterns in a pool can, for a couple of hours at least, smooth out the bumps in his life.

programme.title: White Riot
programme.desc: Telling the story of a vital national protest movement: Rock Against Racism, formed in 1976 when a group of artists united to take on the National Front.

programme.desc: Dom Hemingway is a larger-than-life safecracker with a loose fuse. Back on the streets of London after twelve years in prison, it's time to collect what he's owed for keeping his mouth shut.

programme.title: Toast
programme.desc: Bittersweet story of a food writer's road to adulthood via his association with culinary tastes and smells. A delicious love letter to set to the songs of Dusty Springfield.

programme.title: On a Clear Day
programme.desc: A laid-off Glasgow shipbuilder strives to regain his pride after decades on the docks. Without his family's help, he attempts the ultimate test of endurance-swimming the English Channel.

programme.title: Another Year
programme.desc: This drama chronicles four seasons in the lives of a happy couple and their relationships with family and friends.

programme.title: Wild Target
programme.desc: An assassin with a peerless reputation for lethal efficiency finds himself drawn to one of his intended victims.

programme.title: The Professor and the Madman

programme.title: What We Did on Our Holiday
programme.desc: Doug and Abi take their three children on a trip to Scotland for a big family gathering. They are in the midst of a difficult divorce, and have asked the kids to keep it a secret from their family.

programme.title: Le Week-End
programme.desc: A long-married couple revisit Paris for a long weekend for the first time since their honeymoon, in hopes of rekindling their relationship - or, perhaps, to bring it to an end.

programme.title: The Shadow of Violence
programme.desc: In rural Ireland, an ex-boxer who has an autistic son and is the feared enforcer for a drug-dealing family has his loyalties tested when he's asked to kill for the first time.

programme.title: The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry
programme.desc: Harold is an ordinary man who has passed through life, living on the side lines, until he goes to post a letter one day and just keeps walking.

programme.title: The Secret Scripture
programme.desc: A woman committed to a mental hospital for much of her life must rely on her diary to recount her memories to a doctor who is reassessing her for the move to a new facility.

programme.title: Nowhere Special
programme.desc: A single father dedicates the last few months of his life to finding a new family for his four-year-old son.

programme.title: Stardust (2020)
programme.desc: Meet David before Bowie, one of the greatest icons in music history. But who was the young man behind the many faces?

programme.title: Absolutely Anything
programme.desc: A group of aliens bestow upon a random Earthling the ability to make absolutely anything happen, to see if he uses the power for good or for evil.

programme.title: Mothering Sunday
programme.desc: In 1924, housemaid and foundling Jane Fairchild has the rare chance to spend quality time with her secret lover, but unforeseen events will change the course of Jane's life forever.

programme.title: Vita and Virginia
programme.desc: In 1920's, London, Virginia Wolf meets fellow author Vita Sackville-West. Despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspires a novel.

programme.title: Love and Friendship
programme.desc: A beautiful young widow visits her in-laws' estate while waiting for social chatter about her personal indiscretions to pass.

programme.desc: In 1840s England, acclaimed but overlooked fossil hunter Mary Anning and a young woman sent to convalesce by the sea develop an intense relationship, altering both of their lives forever.

programme.desc: A master auctioneer becomes obsessed with an extremely reclusive heiress and collector of fine art, who he has never actually met.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is headed to Australia to anoint an Aussie worthy of carrying on the river cottage tradition: Paul West. In this episode, the pair will face uniquely Australian challenges and characters.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: What better way to win a town's heart than through its stomach? It's festival time in Tilba and Paul's keen to make an impression with his cooking, but will his locally gathered produce cut it?

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Paul explores the nearby coastline and discovers an abundant source of seafood delicacies. Back on the farm, he builds the pig pen before taking delivery of a small herd that will one day feed him.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Paul discovers a blunder that has left him with only two days of water for the farm and livestock. Wanting to breed his own chickens, Paul buys roosters - some for the farm, and a couple to provide food for the table.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Paul visits the neighbour's bush food orchard, then goes olive picking and takes freshly pressed oil back to the farm. The pressure's on as Paul competes in a regional oyster shucking contest.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Big Boy the pig is now ready for the butcher. This emotionally charged episode brings us face-to-face with what goes into putting meat onto our dinner plate.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Paul goes fly fishing to forage for his lunch, then prepares his catch with a crispy seaweed recipe. On the farm, a simple mistake has put the health of Bessie the cow in jeopardy.

programme.title: River Cottage Australia
programme.desc: Hugh returns and is amazed by what Paul has achieved. Before hosting a community feast, they attempt the art of beach fishing. Has Paul's effort to breed chickens brought new life to the farm?

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: Over the next 10 weeks, 12 baking enthusiasts will undertake a series of intricate baking challenges under the watchful eyes of judges Maggie Beer and Matt Moran.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: It's the second week and the bakers attempt filled biscuits, a tricky technical from Matt, and a showstopper fit for bakers and builders alike.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: This week, the 10 remaining bakers put their best feet forward with choux pastry, a technically demanding Paris-Brest, and a Gateau St Honore showstopper.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: The nine remaining bakers face a tough Signature challenge to reinvent the Australian pie, a tantalising technical twist, and a Showstopper deep dish fruit pie.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: At the halfway point, bakers take on brownies, a frustrating technical of the Black Forest Gateau, and a triple threat Chocolate Medley showstopper.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: This week it's carb overload as bakers tackle savoury flat breads, a technical of knotted bread rolls, and a Showstopper stollen bread challenge.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: In the Signature, bakers make individual puddings. Maggie sets her dried apricot Pavlova in the technical, and they face a spectacular tiered Showstopper.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: The final five roll out pastry skills with miniature savoury pastries, Maggie's mushroom, thyme and leek pithivier, and a strudel Showstopper.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining four bakers take on doughnuts, a passion-filled Passionfruit Tart technical, and a High Tea Showstopper that pushes them to new heights.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: Over nine weeks twelve of Australia's best home bakers competed. Now just three remain and this epic conclusion will test them to new limits.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: More people are connecting with the principles of tiny house living. Andrew Winter follows Australians searching for their dream small space, as they discover that owning less is an opportunity to do more.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: Andrew Winter follows free spirits Alyce and Paul, who hope to leave the hustle and bustle of Melbourne and achieve a life with more freedom by going tiny.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: Taylah and Thomas have decided to buy their first home together on the Sunshine Coast. Will they find a home to suit their individual tastes, or will going tiny be a recipe for disaster? Hosted by Andrew Winter.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: Stacey is determined to find the ultimate beachfront property on Phillip Island, but with a budget of $275,000, she is going to have to make some sacrifices to make her dream come true.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: Eager to leave the rat race of Sydney, Natasha and Lloyd are on the hunt to go small. With a large wish list, will they be able to find the tiny, sustainable house of their dreams?

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: With house prices booming and an extremely tight budget, young couple Chad and Katherine have decided to go tiny in Terrigal. Will this couple find their perfect love nest? Hosted by Andrew Winter.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: Jeremy hopes to find a tiny house in Sydney with natural materials, clean lines and a blurred connection to the outdoors. But since even small spaces can go for a lot, Jeremy's going to need all the good karma he can get.

programme.title: Tiny House Australia
programme.desc: Ali and Belly are on the hunt for a simpler, sustainable life before they tie the knot. But with a tight budget and large wish list, will the honeymoon phase be over before it starts? Hosted by Andrew Winter.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Two single(-ish), complex humans are brought together by a car accident and an injured dog.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: When Ashley makes a mess in Gordon's sock drawer, she makes an impromptu trip to Costco with Colin, Megan and her mother to buy Gordon some new furniture.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Gordon accidentally sends Ashley a d*** pic and chases her from a garage sale to a death bed to try to delete it.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ash and Gordon's awkward sexual encounter causes them to drift apart.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: The Echo Park gang are impressed when Ashley takes charge during a power outage.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ashley takes Gordon to her birthday dinner at Lynelle and creepy Professor Lee's house.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ashley and Gordon's relationship is tested when she invites her party-loving friends to Echo Park to celebrate her birthday.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: After breaking up, Ashley and Gordon must find a new home for Colin so they can go their separate ways.

programme.title: Fighting Season
programme.desc: Four soldiers harbouring secrets return to Australia after an unsanctioned mission in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Fighting Season
programme.sub-title: A Good Soldier Makes A Bad Civilian
programme.desc: After sessions with the army psychiatrist, our soldiers go on a camping trip where an increasingly paranoid Speedo tries to gauge the men's knowledge of the events in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Fighting Season
programme.desc: The men are called in for an unscheduled reinterview by the army, which bolsters Kim's hopes for Ted to be recognised with a posthumous medal.

programme.title: Fighting Season
programme.desc: Speedo becomes a celebrity, further driving a wedge between himself and an increasingly suspicious Kim. Meanwhile, Izzy discovers the tragedy that lies at the heart of his memory loss.

programme.title: Fighting Season
programme.desc: Recalling memories of Ted prior to his deployment, Kim becomes convinced that the increasingly volatile Speedo is responsible for her husband's death.

programme.title: Fighting Season
programme.desc: Kim's accusations threaten maximum damage for Speedo and the Defence Force on Anzac Day. Speedo decides he must reveal the truth about Ted's death.

programme.title: Secret City
programme.desc: Harriet Dunkley is out on parole and eager to leave the swamp of Canberra politics behind. But, before she can escape, she is ensnared in a cover-up with Catriona Bailey's fingerprints all over it.

programme.title: Secret City
programme.desc: Harriet takes up an offer to work for maverick MP Karen Koutoufides, in order to gain access to the corridors of power and save her friend Mina.

programme.title: Secret City
programme.desc: Prime Minister Garrity discovers the existence of a classified military program. Meanwhile, Harriet learns the truth of Mina's secret criminal activities.

programme.title: Secret City
programme.desc: The US Secretary of Defence arrives in the capital for an unscheduled visit. Garrity seeks a private meeting with drone pilot Cal Treloar.

programme.title: Secret City
programme.desc: A desperate Cal threatens Harriet, demanding a one-on-one meeting with Prime Minister Garrity.

programme.title: Secret City
programme.desc: The dogs of war are circling in the corridors of power, urging a reluctant PM to retaliate against Pakistan. Can Harriet stop the march to war in time?

programme.desc: In Leicester, Rick explores Indian food trucks and high tea, visits a mill revived for chapati flour, and cooks tikka masala and matar kulcha.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: West Penwith is as far west as it's possible to go on mainland Britain. From the safety of his kitchen, Rick tells us how, as a young lad, he tasted his first exotic French fish stew, known as a bouillabaisse.

programme.title: Food Safari Water
programme.desc: This program reveals the secrets and benefits of cooking whole fish, featuring fried Thai-style snapper, Malaysian fish head curry, and French rouget en papillote.

programme.title: Food Safari Water
programme.desc: This program pays tribute to the fresh clean flavour of raw seafood, from oysters to fish used in Fijian, Japanese, Italian and Lebanese culinary masterpieces.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Family Adventure
programme.desc: The whole family gather on the island of Sardinia for a long overdue festive celebration. Gino pulls out all the stops to give his mother-in-law, Elizabeth, an Italian festive feast to remember.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie shows how to make sticky pan-fried scallops with sweet chilli rice, dressed greens, and quick brownies.

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: Mary shows us how to cook dishes to impress guests at a dinner party, including two delicious canapes, a salmon and asparagus starter, a main course of guinea fowl and a decadent chocolate tart for pudding.

programme.title: Eat Well For Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris have a challenge on their hands with the Haynes family in Hampshire. Their different tastes mean that they are eating different dinners, causing lots of waste and their food bills to spiral.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Top chefs from across the UK return for season 20 of Great British Menu, competing to impress judges with inventive dishes and secure a place at the prestigious final banquet.

programme.title: Jimmy Doherty's New Zealand Escape
programme.desc: Travelling from the frozen south to the tropical north, Jimmy Doherty explores New Zealand.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Thirteen contestants battle it out to be named Britain's best amateur baker, facing tasks from judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. They must make a sandwich cake, before having to follow Mary's recipe for angel food cake.

programme.desc: A day of relaxation turns deadly for singles when they discover they're not alone. While enjoying activities in and around the ocean, the guests have no idea they are being hunted by sharks.

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: Deep-sea rescue diver Jonas must confront his fears to save a crew trapped on the ocean floor in a submersible that's been attacked by a massive creature.

programme.title: Kiss My Act
programme.desc: An aspiring stand-up comedian with low self-esteem gives her best material to a pretty colleague who attracts a talent scout.

programme.title: Vampire Bats
programme.desc: A college professor (Lucy Lawless) tries to stop aggressive, mutated bats killing people in Louisiana.

programme.title: Christmas Lost and Found
programme.desc: After years of missing family gatherings, event planner Whitney is off to spend Christmas with Grandma Frances. But in an unfortunate turn of events, Whitney throws out a box of precious family ornaments.

programme.title: Hailey Dean: A Prescription For Murder
programme.desc: A psychologist and former prosecutor aids a detective in investigating a rapidly growing string of murders at Atlanta Memorial Hospital.

programme.title: Killer Under the Bed
programme.desc: New to town, a bullied teenager discovers a doll, riddled with pins, in her backyard shed. She soon comes to believe that the doll holds supernatural powers.

programme.title: Morning Show: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: The murder of a supermarket owner puts TV chef Billie Blessings and Detective Ian Jackson on the trail of a possible serial killer.

programme.title: Playing Cupid
programme.desc: A girl sets her single father up with her teacher after starting a matchmaking business for a school project.

programme.title: Angry Angel
programme.desc: Allison Pyke is a young angel who's trying to get her ticket into heaven. Complications arise when two important men in her life unexpectedly show up to form a love triangle.

programme.title: Matchmaker Mysteries: A Fatal Romance
programme.desc: When a romance writer is murdered, matchmaker Angie Dove and Detective Kyle Cooper must read between the lines to find the killer.

programme.title: Marrying Mr. Darcy
programme.desc: Since Elizabeth, who is a down-to-earth high school teacher, and Donovan, a reserved New York businessman, are so different, their trip to the altar is lively and unpredictable.

programme.title: Morning Show Mysteries: Death by Design
programme.desc: A woman's twin sister is found strangled to death.

programme.title: This Christmas
programme.desc: It's Christmas at the Whitfield's, and they're together for the first time in years. As they endure the ups and downs, they rediscover what makes them a family.

programme.title: Turtles All the Way Down
programme.desc: When a 16-year-old struggling with obsessive-compulsive disorder reconnects with her childhood crush, she confronts the possibility of finding love and happiness in the face of mental illness.

programme.title: Mississippi River Sharks
programme.desc: A horror-movie actor faces a school of ferocious sharks that attack during a fishing rodeo being held in Mississippi River.

programme.title: Dam Sharks
programme.desc: A massive storm has washed several bloodthirsty bull sharks into the river and they've begun building a dam out of human remains in order to trap their prey.

programme.title: Fright Night
programme.desc: Teenage Charley Brewster is a horror-film junkie, so it's no surprise that when a reclusive new neighbor moves next-door, Brewster becomes convinced he's a vampire.

programme.title: Love Letters
programme.desc: A man (Steven Weber) and a woman (Laura Linney) maintain a relationship through correspondence begun in childhood.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Frontrunners
programme.desc: Children with microtia are born with an underdeveloped ear. Wearing a mask or glasses is difficult, and they may be bullied. We meet Dr. Yotsuyanagi Takatoshi, a leading reconstructive surgeon.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.desc: A dangerous tick-borne disease is spreading across Japan. It has a fatality rate of about 30 percent and can be transmitted by pets. We look at how we can protect ourselves from SFTS.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Hara Kazuo is the first person from Asia to win the Golden Ring Special Edition prize at an Italian film festival that explores the dark side of movies. He talks about his vision for documentaries.

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: As a constant supply of concrete is required for urbanization around the world, Japanese companies have developed concrete that emits no CO2 during production, and a CO2-absorbing material coating.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: A full moon shines above a bustling neighborhood. Featured prominently are kabuki theaters...on hiatus. Still, people have come out to take in the nightlife, and hopefully a celebrity sighting or two.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: Muse cells, discovered by a Japanese researcher, are found in the human body and have the unique ability to repair tissues. We examine their potential in treating intractable diseases.

programme.title: Blue Economy in African Nations
programme.desc: Featuring voices from African nations at TICAD 9, this program explores the Blue Economy, promoting sustainability, food security, jobs, and resources with insights from the Sasakawa Peace Foundation.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Design X Stories
programme.desc: Today's theme: Compact. This is the key to comfort in limited space, giving rise to designs that fold, layer, and enclose. Explore the beauty and potential in Japan's wide variety of compact designs.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Asia Insight
programme.desc: Mongolia's capital Ulaanbaatar suffers from severe air pollution. New designs use sunlight to ensure warm, smoke-free homes. We explore the technology and its challenges.

programme.title: From Pollution to Solution
programme.desc: Cahyo Laksono is passionate about carbon neutrality. The PhD student sees an opportunity to reuse carbon dioxide emissions in Japan and his native Indonesia to help produce plastics.

programme.title: Japan's Top Inventions
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: eggshell field chalk.

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: Japan's convenience stores stock more than just food. Some sell clothes or provide administrative services. Others even use avatars and robots alongside human employees. We look at Japan's "konbini."

programme.desc: Can humans and nature coexist? Yuji, a pioneering pasture-based dairy farmer, spent his life answering that question, stewarding vast grasslands. As he battles cancer, he passes the baton to his son.

programme.title: From Pollution to Solution

programme.desc: Niigata / Nishizawa Ryue (architect) In a coastal district, boat builders used their skills to make houses. Nishizawa considers how architecture is affected by a community's terrain and values.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Japan

programme.title: Kabuki Kool

programme.title: NHK Newsline

programme.title: Science View
programme.desc: Researchers pursue the technology of threads from a microscopic world, from durable synthetic spider silk to the growth of tiny metal strands, which may have a huge application in high-tech devices.

programme.title: NHK News 7

programme.title: Dive in Tokyo
programme.desc: Hinohara is a mountain village located along the border between Tokyo and Yamanashi Prefecture. We explore its ridge trails, which served as a lifeline for local settlements throughout the centuries.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo

programme.title: Direct Talk

programme.title: Japan from Above

programme.title: Hand-making the Scenery of Life

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Insurance investigator Dennis Stanton, who uses his skills as an ex-thief to solve crimes, returns to investigate a theft and two murders.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's cousin is left waiting at the church when her fiance is murdered in a similar fashion to a murder 15 years ago, for which her brother was blamed.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: While Jessica vacations, her nephew and his pregnant wife enjoy house-sitting, until the body of a strange sea-faring man appears on the living room floor.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Michael Hagarty is involved in a case in Sicily which has many twists and turns including the Mafia.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: In San Francisco, Dennis investigates the murder of Truman Calloway, a man with no shortage of enemies, when the ex-husband of one of Calloway's clients is charged with the murder.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: When a journalist trying to show a man was unjustly convicted of murder 16 years ago dies before finishing his book, Jessica is asked to use his notes to finish the book.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's friends in Westchester county, who just happens to have a penchant for jewellery theft, ends up being arrested for the murder of her chauffeur.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Eve is at a loss to explain how the body of the local gym owner ended up in her bedroom. Jessica agrees to look into the matter after receiving a request from a surprising source.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Preston Giles, Jessica's former publisher and the first murderer she ever caught, has been released from jail.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The book is closed on a book expert after he finds proof that a torched Mark Twain manuscript was a fake.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica heads to Nashville to visit her old friends, Bobby and Patti Sue Diamond, and finds herself embroiled in the middle of a murder mystery when Bobby and Patti Sue are poisoned.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Dennis investigates a fire that burned the hands of famous concert pianist, Vaclav Maryska. When Vaclav's wife winds up murdered, Dennis tries to sort through the suspects and find the killer.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: In Boston, Jessica and Seth are captured by the angry son of one of Seth's patients who didn't survive.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Dennis is suspected in the murder of the husband of an old flame with whom he has been spending some time.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: When Bradley Hellman, the son of an influential ambassador, is murdered only an hour after making bail for drunk driving.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A snoopy fan in Texas impersonates Jessica when she starts investigating a potential dog show scandal and Jessica is reported dead.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A pie factory owner, under pressure to pay money the IRS claims she owes, is suspected of murdering the key witness against her - her ex-husband.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: On a visit to Kentucky horse country, Jessica and Harry McGraw find themselves on the track of a murder.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan's long-time friends, Brian and Meghan, bought a spacious Las Vegas home 13 years ago. Its awkward layout and dated spaces prevent them from truly enjoying it.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan's brother, JD, bought a bachelor pad in an historic Las Vegas neighbourhood eight years ago. With his wedding just a few months away, JD and Annalee want the outdated bachelor pad transformed.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: As newlyweds, Erika and Ben bought a large six-bedroom house. Three children later, this family loves their home but the awkward main-floor layout leaves some rooms underutilised.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.sub-title: Keep The Charm, Ditch The Layout
programme.desc: Kate and Gavin moved into their classic Vegas house as newlyweds. The house's vintage character is part of the charm, but the old-school layout doesn't work for their modern family.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Agostino and Jennifer's two young daughters are the fourth generation in this compact family home. The house is showing its age; its cramped layout doesn't work for this modern family.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.sub-title: Raise The Kids, Ignore The House
programme.desc: 16 years ago, Vanessa and Michael bought a house in Vanessa's childhood neighbourhood. They focused on raising their family, neglecting their aging home.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Chris and Michelle were high-school sweethearts. Now they are raising their two girls right where they want, but their single-storey house is so worn out and tired, their kids are embarrassed to bring over friends.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Rina and Nilesh bought their home as newlyweds. Seven years and two kids later, they still love their house, but are increasingly frustrated by the dated kitchen.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Tamara is immensely proud of the suburban home she bought all on her own. Problem is, the house lacks space for teenage hangouts and family baking sessions.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Newlyweds Nora and Diego live with his parents and grandmother. Their single level Richmond home has ample space, but the family loves to cook and the cramped layout hinders them.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
